result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J Lomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid in 90 days after release from Huber sentence or penalty of 5 days jail, consecutive for non-payment.

With Huber. Sentence credit of 1 day was granted.
Concurrent with: Case 15CM868

Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Affidavit of Services for Court appointed counsel and billing statement, received and filed, by Atty Voss.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Voss makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE:

20 DAYS HUBER  (1 day credit)  Defendant to report on 1/31/16 by 5:00 p.m.     *CONCURERNT WITH CASE #15CM868* 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid in 90 days after release from huber, alternate 5 days jail if not paid)
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.   Attorney Voss requests a sentencing date.  Court adjourns for sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.
Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Anthony J Lomas in court with Attorney Thomas K. Voss.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  State requests cash bail.  Court sets cash bail.  Hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Initial appearance on August 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
